titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ruth (Goodkind) Calvin Photograph Album, 1918-1923
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Emma Gronbeck March 2023.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: The photograph album contains images from Ruth Goodkind Calvin's years at Vassar College, as well as her travels across the United States, particularly the American West and the National Parks.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ruth (Goodkind) Calvin (1902-1957) was born in Chicago to Doctor Maurice L. Goodkind (1866–1939) and Rose (Snydacker) Goodkind (1874–1940). She graduated from Vassar College with the class of 1922. During her college years and after, Calvin travelled extensively across the continental United States. In 1928, she married rancher James F. Calvin and settled in Cerrillos, New Mexico, where she lived until her death in 1957.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The photograph album contains images from Ruth Goodkind Calvin's years at Vassar College, as well as her travels across the United States, particularly the American West and the National Parks. The Vassar photographs occupy about a quarter of the album and depict student life at the college, including a trip to West Point, athletic events, marching band, picnics, plays, ceremonies, buildings and grounds, and dorm life. The remainder of the album includes photographs of Glacier Park, Montana; Blackfoot Native Americans; cowboys, horses, and ranch life; Camp Hanoum in Vermont; Mt. Rainier, Washington; Rocky Mountain National Park and Great Sand Dunes National Park, Colorado; Logan Falls, Pennsylvania; San Ysidro Ranch in Santa Barbara; Chicago; and Kentucky. Also included are images from a visit to IXL Ranch in Wyoming, where Calvin met author Mary Roberts Rinehart (1876-1958).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library .

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Lizzy Young Bookseller, March 2023.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ruth (Goodkind) Calvin Photograph Album, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
